meanings.definition: Obtain by devious or dishonest means.
meanings.sent1: He was finagling his way into getting extra dessert.
meanings.sent2: She was caught finagling the answers during the test.
meanings.sent3: The cat was finagling its way into the closed cookie jar.
meanings.sent4: The politician was accused of finagling his campaign funds.
meanings.sent5: The fox was finagling the chickens out of their feed.

meanings.definition: To manipulate or maneuver in a sly or underhanded way.
meanings.sent1: The magician was finagling the cards to perform his trick.
meanings.sent2: He was finagling the situation to his advantage.
meanings.sent3: The kids were finagling the rules of the game to win easily.
meanings.sent4: She was finagling her hair into an elaborate updo.
meanings.sent5: The spy was finagling his escape from the enemy's grasp.
